comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mary_Mannering "Mary Mannering (April 29, 1876 – January 21, 1953) was an English actress, born in London." "Born Florence Friend, she was the daughter of Richard Friend and Elise Whiting. She was induced by producer Daniel Frohman to come to New York in 1896. In the United States, she began playing as "Mary Mannering" (the maiden name of her father's mother)." NYT of June 2, 1911 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F70F15F83F5517738... reports her marriage to Detroit millionaire Frederick E. Wadsworth, head of the Detroit Motor Boat Company and has a fair amount of biographical detail.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: In January 1916, they announced that she would returned to the stage and they would move to New York. See NYT of Jan 14 1916 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0716FD3B5B1773... But it's not clear that she did make a successful comeback. She lived until 1953. NYT of Jan 22, 1953 select.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=FB0716FD3B5B1773... carries her obituary. Frederick had died in 1927. Nothing of a post-1911 career is mentioned. Also nothing after 1911 in her IBDB entry ibdb.com/person.php?id=51256
